threads.text: Its a beautiful device...

replies.text: Instead of telling just a word u can express more to help peoples here. If u already have the device means give some good feedback. Like what u like more and what u did not like in this device.. It will help peoples like me those looking to buy this ....

threads.text: I'm glad that Huawei Honor is making this wonderful phone available with US LTE radio bands.  I like Huawei.  My first Android phone was an Ideos, which still works (has a removable battery) and serves as a simless VOIP phone in our detached workshop/craft room/gym.  I'm still using my HAM 2 as my daily driver and plan on upgrading to this phone.  (I don't mind the lack of NFC since I'm not wanting to do mobile payments.)  Thank you Huawei for recognizing that many consumers in the US can't spend $1000 on a cell phone.  I do think your high end phones rival Apple's and Samsung's high end phones.  The price point is just too rich for my blood.

I LOVE how they release ANOTHER $200 phone!  If I were looking for another phone, I would get one with wireless ac which this one doesn't have.  I am a happy owner of the Honor5x and I won't be upgrading anytime soon.  If I could Hug Huawei I would.  When I do go looking for a phone, I will look at Huawei first and see what they got.
Does anyone feel like headphone jack is little bit loose or is it just in my piece?

replies.text: or you cable from Headphones,i had never a Problem with this

Cable is good... I've  tried it on other phones. It's just that in honor 7x it is not that tight as compared to other.... I'm not saying that cable falls off. I think my peice has the prob. Just verifying before returning.
ok,not good to hear

threads.text: It will boost up for sure..

Honor made a phone with impressive phone with great build quality at such price range without any doubt.

Hands on to Honor

Coming from Samsung galaxy S7 Edge and LG v20 ( sold all flagship phones because of family issues ) i can say i am in love with this phone. Really nice display. Crisp and sharp. Good battery life with normal usage. Overall very happy with Honor 7X
I got this mobile recently. I am in love with this mobile. Camera is great and overall smooth performance. Battery has power saving mode for running more than 30 hours, with full charge
fast and reliable for daily use

Came from a Nexus 6P of two years and I love this phone!!

Love how easy EMUI theming is and I can make it look like stock android if I want to all without rooting and without the slowness that I found substratum can cause.

Easily getting 5+ hours of SOT on a daily basis; and only time I've noticed any sort of lag is when I haven't used the phone while sleeping; it unlocks quickly via fingerprint but the first app i open takes a second longer to open then its back to it's snappy self.
Love it! Thing is a beast!
Haven't seen any developers around but fingers crossed
Its a new released phone. May be in future we hope some good developments for this mobile
Link
Post any ROM links( if you can find any )
I'd be happy with  rootable debloated rom someday.  Hopefully with the reasonable price of this phone a few dev's will pick it up.
Before using honor 7x , i m on Redmi 3s (Land ) , Yureka(Tomato ) both phones Have awesome development ! i hope Honor7x (Bond ) have better development 🙃
The upcoming treble support makes this phone the currently cheapest phone with that, which is incredibly good!

I was expecting the phone to have trouble multitasking. But for normal use using apps (not games) it works perfectly. I haven't had any apps close on me while I was switching between them.

Just be sure to use the default launcher. Tried using nova for a while and multitasking would slow the phone to the point of making it unusable.

I am the 4gb, 64gb version and I use Nova launcher and I'm able to multitask and do anything I want without problems. I easily go over 24hours of usage with at least 6hours of screen on time, with gaming. Very happy of the phone.

replies.text:
Same here. I have the 4gb 64gb version, unlocked bootloader, root with recovery. All bloatware removed or frozen via TWRP.

I have an average of 2.6-2.8gb free ram!!

This phone is FAST and I'm also able to get around 6 hours SOT over a 24 hour period easily. VERY impressive for a 6'' device, really amazing battery and efficient processor.

threads.text: My 3gb USA model gets me from day to day operations but suffers from severe freezing/lag at random times while browsing the web or viewing social media. I barely see any forums mentioning similar behavior so I'm starting to think I need to factory reset or I have a defective unit

replies.text:
Mine does this.  Will basically freeze and not let me do anything.  Does it often.  I guess I will reset and see what happens.

Love the phone but can't handle the lag.

I'm stumped by people that say it's fast with no issues.

Yeah I feel like I'm in the twilight zone when I see people saying the speed is fine with minimal lag. That what leads me to think we may have defective units. With the Honor 6x I've seen people say that a factory reset fixed their issues.

They probably post after only using it a few days. Mine was fine at first. After about a week sometimes it would freeze, especially if I'd recently used facebook and chrome the keyboard would struggle. I'd need to either wait or kill a few apps and it would go back to being okay.

The stock camera software has a lot of features, but it is waaaaaay to slow. 

I needed a new phone, but we had a lot of expenses last year and so I bought something cheap. It's not terrible. I'll be happy to get a year out of it.

threads.text: Much better after factory reset.  Slows still from time to time but no just stand still freezes.  Bearable.  I want this phone with these features with flagship internals though still.  Thinking the view 10 may fit that when it comes to US.

replies.text: OK thanks for the update, I will reset mine this weekend and will also be anticipating the View 10, especially if the price is right.

threads.text: I've found that disabling many of the Honor and EMUI apps (via Package Disabler or other methods) has made a huge difference in speed as well as battery life personally.

I've also experienced seemingly random slowdowns.  Facebook seems to trigger it alot.  clearing open apps speeds it back up. 

Interestingly, it seems like it could be a ram issue, but i've never seen less than 1gb free ram, usually about 1.4gb free

I'll try disabling the emui/huawei apps to see if that helps.

I can't wait for oreo and project treble, then i can run regular aosp based without the emui bs.

replies.text: Ive had this phones less than a month and I have experienced the lag while using some social media apps and the camera has been slow beyond any other devices I've had before... I had the February security update after one day of use, after noticing the continuous lag I booted into recovery and cleared the cache, seems like that has helped to avoid the lag so far. Maybe others can go ahead and try that, see if it also helps!

threads.text: I have experienced no lag or issues whatsoever, I've had the phone going on a month.

I have some lag too, i ussually remove the apps from the drawer to make it fast again. When you use any torrent app you cant do almost anything else that draws too much ram....i think is a software issue because i had played some mobas and they dont show me any lag on it, unless i have another powerfull app in the drawer.
Often it's fine, but after switching apps it can get slow. Keyboard lag can be painful and the camera app sometimes takes over a minute to open and be fully functional.
It's still smooth on stock os.
Using it from last 20days i feel no heating issue while on charging also

replies.text: Same here and Gaming

threads.text: Mine heats up

replies.text:
A Little Advice.. 
If you do indeed have heat while charging with the OEM charger or light gaming.. and you are still within your 15 return / replace policy ( at least that's what it is when you purchase from the Honor U.S.A. website ) you need to swap out your unit or get your refund.

Heat is ALWAYS an early precursor to a shorter than normal lifespan.

If you are ok with this, or plan to sell the 7X in lieu of something else later this year.. then it's not that big of a deal.
For those that plan to make this a 1 to 2 year device.. and you can still return / exchange it.. I would advise that you do so.

threads.text: Heats up a little but not bad at all. Never so much it's uncomfortable to hold.
All phones heat up these days. Especially during charge or heavy use. All said honor 7x don't heat up much.

replies.text: from lg g flex 2 who was famous for heating i passed to honor 7x and i cant notice any heat at al even when i charge and use. i love this phone

title: Time to take picture (camera launch speed)

threads.text: If we close camera app then open again there is some delay for opening the app. If the app is in memory then its open very quickly.
If I do the ultra shot (volume down twice), it will show me my time until the camera takes the picture.  Average is 1.2 sec.
It's less than a second.

Did not get much time to capture some shots with my new 7X. Here is some images that i took with 7X. All shots are from Auto mods. Nothing edited. Not get a chance to take Potrait shots. I know Potrait shot in 7X is just a joke only.. Its really sucks...
Looking to get this for my mom, but with all the photos I've seen, they're all just... INCREDIBLY DARK...
Photos have nice colors
After seeing these photos, I can only say rear cameras with 16MP f/2.2 and 2-mp works together. Though sometimes the supported light is not enough. But most of the time, it works fabulously.
Try using the front camera in normal lighting condition and than cry in a corner because it just sucks...😞

Photos are really bad in lower light conditions. The Pixel Camera port is not available for this chipset 
The screen is nice but camera plain sucks
can the camera improve with an update?

replies.text: For sure but only if someone works on the camera software
What if some other phone's camera app is made to use in honor 7x

threads.text: Had mine few days 64GB/4GB blue and while yes it's a cosmetic upgrade over 6x I feel camera and performance isn't that much better some tweaking needed and yes low light is horrid
Honor 7x seems to be much promising but yet I am confused if it can perform better than Mi A1. Software is the thing that can revolutionize the hardware functionality like camera.

threads.text:
Got my device day before yesterday. Amazon India.. Just did a charging test. 

From 0 to 90% it took 2 hour 30 minute with mobile on.. 

From 0 to 90% it took 2 hour 12 minute with mobile off..

Yes it is.. Hope it will solve after some charging cycles or changing adaptor or something.. Anyway just getting one day battery. So happy with it

threads.text: Around 3.5 hours with high speed charger. My other phone only takes 1 hour 30 minutes having the same battery output.
The charging speed has improved after 2 months since I got this device. I'm using the included charger. Not Moto G4 speed but good enough for my needs.

does Kirin 659 supports fast charging?
i read online that Maimang 6, nova 2 ( whicha have kirin 659) support fast charge. Is there any possibility in honor 7x , fast charge can be enabled via a firmware update?
Charges from 0-90% in 1hr40m when switched off. Quite slow when on, though.
that not so fast man.. i guest

I wanted to post the very good results I get from my battery after all my good settings.

So I usually have way more than 24 hours of battery life with moderate to heavy usage. And I can go over 8 hours of screen on time, with wifi, 4g, and a bit of gaming not restricting anything. What are your results?
Superb.. Only 2% battery in 7 hour 30 minutes.
Not very fast. Little worried about charging speed. While mobile is off then it took 2 hour 16 minute to reach from 0 to 90%. Ok but sometimes feels bad

5hrs SOT time, normal use (instagram 1 hr, yt 1hr, netflix 2 episodes of 1 hour, other 1hr)
3 1/2 hrs SOT time, stress use (1hr calls, instagram, yt, web browsing)
Hope this gives you a little jist.. The battery is pretty good since i use a few battery hogging apps for background.. Easily lasts more than a day for me..

Very happy with the battery life. I know after 6 or 7 months the battery life will be reduce but its overall a good package.. Sharing some screens here. 

This SOT i got with second charging. Charged from 0 to 90% (Not 100%) and used.  This SOT result is from 90% . Not from 100%. 

Usage:-
======

Whatsapp
YouTube
Chrome and downloads
Some minutes of Cricket game play
Some videos in MX Player
XDA App
Calls and SMS
Some musics
No FB and Messenger
Full time LTE ( JIO voLTE India)
Dual sim all time




Here i just disabled some apps that i never use..

Same here 7:12 Sot. With root and delete all unnecessary apps.
Sorry i forgot the Screenshot.Next time
good enough
Good inmy case without games always on 4g
I've got over 8 hours SOT quite often now, not restricting anything (gaming, calls, wifi, 4g)

I have never had the chance to test battery but standby drain is excellent.

However, for heavy gaming battery life is poor and the device significantly heats up. I can completely finish my battery from 100% to 0% in around 3 hours with a game like Angry Birds 2. However, even on other devices it's known to be hard on the battery and unoptimized.

In the next coming days I'll test battery with regular use and not gaming, general web browsing and some YouTube perhaps.

However, I easily get a full day out the battery, I am impressed.
Ace
The phone looks good, with its rounded corners and speaker grille. Maybe the cameras would have been better leveled with the rest of the body, but otherwise pretty nice!..
Really a good looking phone..
